文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk1
证据片段: compared with earlier results for Zircaloy-2 and Zircaloy-4

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk1
证据片段: Cylindrical specimens (about $2 . 5 4 ~ \mathrm { c m }$ long and $1 . 2 7 ~ \mathrm { c m }$ diameter) were machined from commercially produced bar stock

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk1
证据片段: pickled in a hydrofluoric acid-nitric acid-sulfuric acid-water $( \mathbf { H } \mathbf { F } { \cdot } \mathbf { H } \mathbf { N } \dot { \mathbf { O } } _ { 3 } { \cdot } \mathbf { H } _ { 2 } \mathbf { S } \mathbf { O } _ { 4 } { \cdot } \mathbf { H } _ { 2 } \mathbf { O } )$ solution

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk1
证据片段: For $\mathbf { Z r } { - } 2 . 5 \mathbf { N b }$ $K _ { p } \ = \ 2 . 6 8 \times 1 0 ^ { 6 } \exp ( - 2 0 2 7 6 / \mathrm { T } )$ for oxidation temperatures below about $1 5 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk1
证据片段: The corresponding expressions for the Zircaloys are $K _ { p } = 3 . 3 6 \times 1 0 ^ { 5 } \exp ( - 1 6 9 4 9 / \mathrm { T } )$ at oxidation temperatures below $1 5 8 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk2
证据片段: Above 1580°C, δ is similar for both alloys

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk2
证据片段: The occurrence of a discontinuity in the temperature dependence of δ is consistent with observations on Zircaloy although the discontinuity for Zr-2.5Nb occurs at a lower temperature than for Zircaloy

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk3
证据片段: Above $1 5 7 7 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ , the phase diagram indicates that $\beta$ zirconium reacts with oxygen to form a layer of tetragonal $\mathbf { Z r O } _ { 2 }$ , a layer of cubic $\mathbf { Z r O } _ { 2 }$ , and a layer of oxygen stabilized $_{ \alpha }$ -zirconium.

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk3
证据片段: When cooled through $1 5 7 7 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ , the cubic $\mathbf { Z r O } _ { 2 }$ undergoes a eutectoid decomposition to tetragonal $\mathrm { { Z r O } } _ { 2 } ~ + ~ \alpha \cdot$ zirconium. The volume fraction of $_ \alpha$ -zirconium resulting from the decomposition is about 10 percent.

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk3
证据片段: When further cooled through $1 0 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ the tetragonal $\mathbf { Z r O } _ { 2 }$ undergoes another eutectoid decomposition to stable monoclinic $\mathrm { Z r O } _ { 2 } ~ + ~ \alpha$ -zirconium. The volume fraction resulting from this decomposition is only about 1 to 2 percent.

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk3
证据片段: The discontinuity for Zircaloy occurs at $1 5 8 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ which is close to the temperature predicted by the $\bf { z r { - } } 0$ phase diagram for the occurrence of a structural change in the oxide.

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk3
证据片段: There is no significant difference between the oxidation rate of Zr!.5Nb and the Zircaloys in steam at temperatures greater than $1 0 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$

文献ID: STP633-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_3rd Volume_017_chunk4
证据片段: The behavior of Zircaloy-clad fuel rods for light water reactors under offnormal operating conditions is being studied in the Power Burst Facility.
